message.content:
cs.SI, cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR 

The paper discusses the value of diversification versus specialization in scientific research, which is a topic that can be relevant to several sub-categories in computer science. The authors analyze the scientific production of researchers, which involves data analysis and classification, suggesting that the paper could fit in the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the study involves the attribution of value to each publication, which could be related to the sub-category of cs.DL (Digital Libraries). The authors also mention the field classification of publications, which could be associated with the sub-category of cs.IR (Information Retrieval). Furthermore, the paper discusses the implications of the results at the policy level, which could be relevant to the sub-categories of cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
